sen.j: 当摩広島（たいまのひろしま、天武天皇元年（672年）6月または7月）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: TAIMA no Hiroshima (July or August, 672) was a person who lived in the Asuka period of Japanese history.
sen.cmt: 括弧内の年月→没年月と思われますが、原文どおり特に補足せずそのまま訳しました。
sen.e: TAIMA no Hiroshima (July or August, 672) was a person who lived in the Asuka period of Japan.
sen.cmt: Japanese historyはJapanで充分と思われます。
sen.e: TAIMA no Hiroshima (July or August, 672) was a person who lived in the Asuka period of Japan.
His name is also read TAGIMA.
sen.cmt: 名→名字のことかと思われますが、そのまま”名”と訳しました。
sen.e: His name is also read TAGIMA.
His name is also read TAGIMA.

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは同じ。
sen.e: His name is pronounced the same way in old Japanese syllabary characters.
His name is pronounced the same way in old Japanese syllabary characters.
His name is pronounced the same way in old Japanese syllabary characters.
His kabane (hereditary title) was Kimi.
sen.cmt: 公→括弧内に姓の説明があるので、公についてはそのままローマ字表記のみとしました。
sen.e: His kabane (hereditary title) was Kimi.
His kabane (hereditary title) was Kimi.

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱のとき吉備国の守だったが、大友皇子（弘文天皇）が遣わした使者に殺された。
sen.e: In the Jinshin War in 672, he was the governor of Kibi Province, and was killed by an envoy sent by Prince Otomo (Emperor Kobun).
In the Jinshin War in 672, he was the governor of Kibi Province, and was killed by an envoy sent by Prince Otomo (later Emperor Kobun).
sen.cmt: 天皇名にlaterを補足しました。
sen.e: In the Jinshin War in 672, he was the governor of Kibi Province, and was killed by an envoy sent by Prince Otomo (later Emperor Kobun).

sen.j: 当摩氏（当麻氏）は用明天皇の子孫にあたる皇族系の氏族である。
sen.e: The Taima clan (当摩氏) (also written 当麻氏) was descended from Emperor Yomei and related to the imperial family.
sen.cmt: 当摩氏、当摩氏→漢字表記が関係するので、訳文にも漢字を入れました。
sen.e: The Taima clan (当摩氏) (also written 当麻氏) was descended from Emperor Yomei and related to the imperial family.
The Taima clan (当摩氏) (also written 当麻氏) was descended from Emperor Yomei and related to the imperial family.

sen.j: 当摩公広島は、壬申の乱が勃発したときに吉備国の守であった。
sen.e: TAIMA no Kimi Hiroshima was the governor of Kibi Province when the Jinshin War broke out.
sen.cmt: 当摩公→インターネット検索では”たぎまのきみ”の方が若干多くヒットしましたが、ここまで”たいま”で統一されているので、ここも”たいまのきみ”と訳しました。
sen.e: TAIMA no Kimi Hiroshima was the governor of Kibi Province when the Jinshin War broke out.
TAIMA no Kimi Hiroshima was the governor of Kibi Province when the Jinshin War broke out.

sen.j: 吉備に軍を発するよう命じる使者を出した大友皇子は、広島がかつて大海人皇子（天武天皇）の下についていたことから、広島も反乱に同調するのではないかと疑った。
sen.e: Prince Otomo, who sent an envoy to Kibi Province to order to rise an army, suspected that Hiroshima might sympathize with the rebellion, as Hiroshima had once served under Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu).

Prince Otomo, who sent an envoy to Kibi Province to order to raise an army, suspected that Hiroshima might sympathize with the rebellion, as Hiroshima had once served under Prince Oama (later Emperor Tenmu).
sen.cmt: rise an armyはraise an armyが正しいと思われます。
sen.e: Prince Otomo, who sent an envoy to Kibi Province to order to raise an army, suspected that Hiroshima might sympathize with the rebellion, as Hiroshima had once served under Prince Oama (later Emperor Tenmu).

sen.j: そこで大友皇子は「もし服従しない様子があったら、殺せ」と使者の樟磐手に命じた。
sen.e: Prince Otomo then ordered the envoy, KUSU no Iwate, as follows: 'Kill Hiroshima if he does not obey the order.'
sen.cmt: 殺せ→”広島を（殺せ）”と補足しました。
sen.e: Prince Otomo then ordered the envoy, KUSU no Iwate, as follows: 'Kill Hiroshima if he shows any indications that he will not obey the order.'
sen.cmt: if以下を原文の意味に沿って修正しました。天皇名にlaterを補足しました。
sen.e: Prince Otomo then ordered the envoy, KUSU no Iwate, as follows: 'Kill Hiroshima if he shows any indications that he will not obey the order.'

sen.j: 磐手は吉備国について符（命令書）を授ける日に、広島を欺いて刀を解かせた。
sen.e: Iwate arrived in Kibi Province, and on the day Fu (a letter missive) was handed over, he cheated Hiroshima into taking the sword off.
Iwate arrived in Kibi Province, and on the day Fu (a letter missive) was handed over, he deceived Hiroshima into taking the sword off.
sen.cmt: cheatedはdeceivedとする方が適切と思われます。
sen.e: Iwate arrived in Kibi Province, and on the day Fu (a letter missive) was handed over, he deceived Hiroshima into taking the sword off.

sen.j: それから自分の刀を抜いて広島を殺した。
sen.e: Then Iwate drew his sword and killed Hiroshima.
Then Iwate drew his sword and killed Hiroshima.
Then Iwate drew his sword and killed Hiroshima.
